name: electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21027/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in a natural gas, combined cycle power plant in Colombia in 2014. This dataset was created from the "electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle, power plant, GLO" dataset, retrieved on November 20 of 2017. Some of the exchanges and parameters were regionalized with data from Colombian power plants, including: efficiency, total net electricity production, carbon dioxide fossil, methane fossil, dinitrogen monoxide, nitrogen oxide and sulfur dioxide. The regional data was obtained from power plants that represent 76% of the natural gas combined cycle, electricity production in Colombia in 2014.combined cycle, electricity production in Colombia in 2014.;['text', ' - Emissions of NOx, CO, CO2, SO2, particles, N2O and CH4 are mainly taken from CORINAIR 2001, EPA, and a variety of other data sources '];['text', '-\tNOx emissions are a major challenge in natural gas power plants. With rising temperature, emissions also rise; band widths of NOx emissions in literature are correspondingly large. There are several methods to diminish these emissions.'];['text', '-\tCO is a result of uncomplete burning. For economic and technical reasons, plant combustion is optimized and CO emissions are low. '];['text', '-\tCO2 and SO2 emissions are dependent on the composition of the used fuel. Due to the low sulfur content of the used natural gas, no desulfurization has to take place.'];['text', '-\tParticles are assumed to be smaller than 2.5 micro-m'];['text', 'former UCTE: Union for the Coordination of the Transmission of Electricity, since 2009 replaced by ENTSO-E European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity.'];['text', 'Sources:'];['text', '-\tCORINAIR 2001. EMEP/CORINAIR 2001: Joint EMEP/CORINAIR Atmospheric Emission Inventory Guidebook, Third Edition. Copenhagen: European Environment Agency, 2001. http://reports.eea.eu.int/technical_report_2001_3/en.'];['text', '-\tEPA 1998. US Environmental Protection Agency (1998). Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, Fifth Edition, Volume I: Chapter 1: External Combustion Sources, Natural Gas Combustion - Final Section - Supplement D , July 1998. CHIEF (Clearinghouse for Inventories and Emission Factors). Research Triangle Park, North Carolina. http://www.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/.'];['text', '-\tRentz O., Karl U., Peter H. (2002). Ermittlung und Evaluierung von Emissionsfaktoren f\xfcr Feuerungsanlagen in Deutschland f\xfcr die Jahre 1995, 2000 und 2010. Deutsch- Franz\xf6sisches Institut f\xfcr Umweltforschung, Uni Karsruhe. Endbericht. Im Auftrag des Umweltbundesamtes. Forschungsbericht 299 43 142. Umweltbundesamt. Berlin.']

From the constructed  combined cycle natural gas power plant ready to produce electricity. 

From reception of natural gas and operating materials at power plant/factory gate

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes:
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants.
 - Cooling: It is a assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower. No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
 - decarbonised water use for reduction of NOx emissions

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets.
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is based on the GLO dataset with adjustments to the regional context with data from combined cycle natural gas power plants in Colombia.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Combined cycle power plant of 400MWe class with a gas turbine 265MWe and a steam turbine 140MWe. The plant is used for middle load with 5000 hours of operation at full capacity per year. The plant is assumed to operate 180000 hours during its lifetime.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This dataset is based on: electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant, GLO. The following parameters and exchanges were regionalized with data from Colombian power plants that account for 76% of the natural gas combined cycle, electricity production in Colombia in 2014.

Exchange amounts regionalizated: carbon dioxide, methane fossil, dinitrogen monoxide, nitrogen oxide, sulfur dioxide.

Parameters regionalizated: net electricity production and efficiency.

The cooling and feed water use has been taken over from datasets for electricity production with hard coal or lignite.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: A literature review was carried out with a bottom-up approach of the natural gas, combined cycle, power plants in Colombia.

flow.name: electricity, high voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from natural gas power plants, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data and emission values of Colombia.
 
Source of electricity production and fuel consumption data: XM National Statistics   
XM Información inteligente, histórico de oferta, generación 2014
XM Información inteligente, histórico de oferta, combustible 2014
http://informacioninteligente10.xm.com.co/oferta/Paginas/HistoricoOferta.aspx accessed on 21/07/2017

Fuel name: “Gas Natural Generico”
Emission factor: 0.0001 ton N2O/TJ  (Updated on December 7 of 2016) 

Source of emission factors for Colombian fuels: Unidad de Planeación Minero Energética (UPME), Factores de Emisión para Combustibles Colombianos (FECOC).  
http://www.upme.gov.co/calculadora_emisiones/aplicacion/ayuda.html) accessed 17/07/2017

flow.name: Dinitrogen monoxide
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Value taken over from the dataset of natural gas burned in a normal power plant (electricity production, natural gas, GLO 2008). 

Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007, JP and US in the appendix) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from natural gas, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data and emission values of Colombia.
The emissions data were collected from “Environmental Compliance Reports” that are reported by power plants to the Ministry of Environment in order to obtain licenses, and are available under request at the National Environmental Licensing Authority. This exchange is a weighted average of the emissions from TebsaB, Flores IV, Termovalle and Termosierra power plants (based on net electricity production)  that account for 76% of the natural gas, combined cycle net electricity production in Colombia in 2014. 

TebsaB: 1.00E-04 (kg NOx/kWh) // 5.61E+09 kWh
Flores IV: 4.46E-04 (kg NOx/kWh) // 2.09E+09 kWh
Termovalle: 3.89E-04 (kg NOx/kWh) // 5.81E+08 kWh
Termosierra: 4.22E-04 (kg NOx/kWh) // 4.21E+08 kWh

Soruce of emissions: Environmental Compliance Reports (ICA)
TebsaB, ICA #13, 2016
Flores IV, ICA #19, 2015
Termovalle ICA #13, 2015
Termosierra ICA #16, 2016

Source of electricity production: XM National Statistics   
XM Información inteligente, histórico de oferta, generación 2014
http://www.xm.com.co/Paginas/Home.aspx accessed on 21/07/2017

flow.name: Beryllium II
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Cooling water, decarbonised, for the cooling water circuit lost and NOx reduction when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Tab. 11.25, p. 143. For natural gas burned in a combined cycle plant (Tab. 11.25), an amount of 0.5 kg water per MJ burned was taken into account in Röder et al. 2007. As the reasons for this are not documented any more, the cooling water use has been taken over to the combined cycle plant dataset for consistency reasons.

Röder et al. 2007 state that CC plants have a lower cooling water need than conventional plants. However, as written above, water use for NOx reduction is also taken into account.

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Value taken over from the dataset of natural gas burned in a normal power plant (electricity production, natural gas, GLO 2008). 

Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: PAH, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity from natural gas, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data and emission values of Colombia.

The emissions data were collected from “Environmental Compliance Reports” that are reported by power plants to the Ministry of Environment in order to obtain licenses, and are available under request at the National Environmental Licensing Authority. This exchange is a weighted average (net electricity production weighted mean) of the emissions from: Flores IV and Termovalle power plants that account for 23,3% of the natural gas, combined cycle electricity production in Colombia in 2014. 

Termovalle: 1,26 E-05 (kg SO2/kWh) // 5.81E+08 kWh
Flores IV: 4,91 E-05 (kg SO2/kWh) // 2.09E+09 kWh
Weighted average: 4,11 E-05 kg SO2/kWh

Soruce of emissions: Environmental Compliance Reports (ICA)
Flores IV, ICA #19, 2015
Termovalle ICA #13, 2015

Source of electricity production: XM National Statistics   
XM Información inteligente, histórico de oferta, generación 2014
http://www.xm.com.co/Paginas/Home.aspx accessed on 21/07/2017

flow.name: Sulfur dioxide
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Literature value/calculated value. Feed water for the steam circuit lost when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Röder et al. 2007, Tab. 9.65 and Tab. 9.66, p. 160f. For natural gas burned in a combined cycle plant (Tab. 11.25), the feed water was taken into account in Röder et al. 2007 by modelling it with decorbonised water being treated with sodium hydroxide and hydrochloric acid directly in the dataset. For consistency reasons, now also the completely softened water is taken into account.

flow.name: water, completely softened
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply
